The 2025 Epilogue logger seems very useful and something I want to try out, the only problem is I can’t find the bind() method. I have generated the Epilogue file correctly by building code after marking a class for logging, but no were in the Epilogue class is the bind() method. The only documentation I can find says to use it, so I’m at a stand still. The logging code will still be generated, but you’ll need to call it manually.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eI really don’t recommend mixing advantagekit with other logging frameworks (epilogue included), since advantagekit has very specific needs and code structure to support replay. If you’re just trying things out, you can remove the advantagekit logging and replace it with epilogue, and change your robot class’s base class from \u003ccode\u003eLoggedRobot\u003c/code\u003e to
